Ind AS 1.title: Presentation of Financial Statements
rules: Financial statements must include: Balance Sheet, Profit & Loss, Cash Flow Statement, Statement of Changes in Equity, and Notes.
Profit & Loss must present both profit/loss and other comprehensive income.
Salary and wages, rent, and depreciation are classified as operating expenses.
Depreciation is a non-cash expenditure but must be included in the income statement.
Comparative financials for previous periods are mandatory.

Ind AS 2.title: Inventories
rules: Inventories must be valued at the lower of cost or net realisable value (NRV).
Cost includes purchase cost, conversion cost, and other directly attributable costs.
Inventory costing methods allowed: FIFO and Weighted Average.

Ind AS 7.title: Statement of Cash Flows
rules: Cash flows must be categorized into operating, investing, and financing activities.
Cash equivalents include demand deposits and short-term highly liquid investments.
Both direct and indirect methods of presenting cash flows are acceptable.

Ind AS 8.title: Accounting Policies, Changes in Estimates and Errors
rules: Changes in accounting policies must be applied retrospectively unless impracticable.
Prior period errors must be corrected in the next financial statement.
Entities must disclose major assumptions and estimation uncertainties.

Ind AS 10.title: Events after the Reporting Period
rules: Adjusting events provide evidence of conditions that existed at the balance sheet date.
Non-adjusting events are those arising after the reporting date and must be disclosed if material.

Ind AS 12.title: Income Taxes
rules: Current tax is calculated on taxable profit.
Deferred tax is based on temporary differences between accounting and tax treatment.
Deferred tax liabilities are classified as non-current liabilities.
Deferred tax assets must be recognized if it is probable that taxable profit will be available.
Offsetting current/deferred tax assets and liabilities is allowed if a legal right exists and they relate to the same authority.

Ind AS 16.title: Property, Plant and Equipment
rules: Initial measurement is at cost: purchase price + costs to bring to use + restoration costs.
Entities can use cost model or revaluation model for subsequent measurement.
Depreciation must reflect usage pattern; component depreciation required.
Derecognition when asset is disposed or no longer generates economic benefit.

Ind AS 19.title: Employee Benefits
rules: Short-term benefits include salary and bonus — settled within 12 months.
Defined Contribution plans require only fixed payments by employer.
Defined Benefit plans obligate employer to provide fixed retirement benefit, requiring actuarial valuation.
Other long-term benefits accrue over time and must be disclosed and measured reliably.
